content.description: Some tricky oppositional moves and bear hugging of a shield lead to blocky climbing in a wide crack.
content.location: This route is the sixth route in from the left on the main wall. It The bolts zig right and then trend left toward a wide blocky crack. The anchors are on the left side of the crack.

content.description: Steep climbing on larger holds leads to a clean vertical face.
content.location: This is the eighth route in from the left on the Main Wall. It begins to the right of a large right-leaning blocky crack.

content.description: Very fun! Starts out on steep jugs, but stays on you even as the angle eases and the holds get smaller. Get a good rest in before pulling the final hard moves onto the slab. Careful of the tree towards the top.
content.location: This is the first (right most) route on the main wall. You know you're in the right spot if you're belaying from the mossy swamp with the scramble ramp to the Via Ferrata just to your right.

content.description: Jugs in the yellow stone lead to a 2 bolt crux on perfect rock. Sidepulls, precise footwork and a dynamic move or two will get you to the chains.
content.location: This route begins just down hill and to the right of "Whisper Pine" 5.11c (which climbs right in front of a tree near the cliff). The bolts start from a nice rock seat and dive a little left and back right before disappearing over the bulge at the top.
